text.p: Fidelity Bankshares Inc said Monday it has reached a definitive agreement to acquire BankBoynton for about $5.6 million.
Fidelity said the acquisition of the Boynton Beach, Fla.-based thrift has has been approved by the boards of directors of both companies.
It also is subject to the approval of BankBoynton's stockholders and appropriate regulatory agencies. The merger is expected to close during the fourth quarter of 1997.
Under the deal, which is structured on a purchase accounting basis, Fidelity is to acquire all the outstanding common stock of BankBoynton for $9.00 per share in cash.

Fidelity operates Fidelity Federal Savings Bank of Florida with assets of $1 billion and 21 offices in Palm Beach and Martin counties. As a result of this acquisition, BankBoynton's three offices will be merged into Fidelity Federal's existing branch network, the company said.
